titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4909, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4909, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 78

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 4909, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, May 18th.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-51, modified by the amendment printed in part A of H. Rept. 114-569, shall be considered as adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Armed Services now printed in the bill. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as the original bill for the purpose of further amendment under the five-minute rule.<P/>McKinley amendment (No. 10 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569) that seeks to require the Secretary of Defense to ensure that every tactical missile program of the Department of Defense that uses solid propellant as the primary propulsion system shall have at least two fully certified rocket motor suppliers in the event that one of the rocket motor suppliers is outside the national technology and industrial base;<P/>Nadler amendment (No. 12 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569) that seeks to remove funding prohibitions on the closure of the prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; and<P/>Poe (TX) amendment (No. 14 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569), as modified, that seeks to insert a proposed new text for Sec. 1048.<P/>H. Res. 732, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4909) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 181 noes, Roll No. 197, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 177 nays, Roll No. 196.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 4909, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, May 18th.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-51, modified by the amendment printed in part A of H. Rept. 114-569, shall be considered as adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Armed Services now printed in the bill. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as the original bill for the purpose of further amendment under the five-minute rule.<P/>McKinley amendment (No. 10 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569) that seeks to require the Secretary of Defense to ensure that every tactical missile program of the Department of Defense that uses solid propellant as the primary propulsion system shall have at least two fully certified rocket motor suppliers in the event that one of the rocket motor suppliers is outside the national technology and industrial base;<P/>Nadler amendment (No. 12 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569) that seeks to remove funding prohibitions on the closure of the prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; and<P/>Poe (TX) amendment (No. 14 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-569), as modified, that seeks to insert a proposed new text for Sec. 1048.<P/>H. Res. 732, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4909) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 234 ayes to 181 noes, Roll No. 197, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 177 nays, Roll No. 196.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO GO TO CONFERENCE ON S. 524, COMPREHENSIVE ADDICTION AND RECOVERY ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO GO TO CONFERENCE ON S. 524, COMPREHENSIVE ADDICTION AND RECOVERY ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 78

congVote.result: So the motion to instruct was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House rejected the Esty motion to instruct conferees on S. 524 by a yea-and-nay vote of 182 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 198. The motion was debated Friday, May 13th.

extension.searchTitle: ZIKA VECTOR CONTROL ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 78

congVote.result: So (two-thirds not being in the affirmative) the motion was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House failed to agree to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>H.R. 897, amended, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 262 yeas to 159 nays, Roll No. 199.
